Articles.Content: Is there/will there be a way to use custom variables in the part.cfg files?
Yes, that\'s what the plugin system is all about.
Ok. kinda figured that. Any insight into how the game reads the cfg? i.e. How do I get a custom variable from the cfg without parsing it myself?

just put it in

myVar = 0

in the .cfg file

will over ride

public float myVar = 15f;

in the .cs file
Thank You, Did not expect it to be so easy.

it\'s a real treat, indeed - harvester said the .cfg parser is based on the reflection system which is built in to MONO, and thus Unity, thus KSP :

so whatever properties you expose as 'public' in the class, shall be automatically exposed for cfg-based manipulation - cool, huh? :thumbup:
